message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis employs data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize a unique dataset consisting of satellite-based estimates of rainfall and crop yields in Africa to study the relationship between climate variability and food insecurity.", "dataset": ["satellite-based estimates of rainfall", "crop yields in Africa"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on nationally representative household surveys conducted in Mexico, Brazil, and Peru to examine the impact of conditional cash transfer programs on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["nationally representative household surveys conducted in Mexico", "Brazil", "Peru"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We combine administrative records from the Mexican Social Security Institute and census data to estimate the impact of universal health coverage on formal employment and wages.", "dataset": ["Mexican Social Security Institute", "census data"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using firm-level data on exports and productivity from India, we study the impact of financial development on firm performance.", "dataset": ["firm-level data on exports and productivity from India"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the effectiveness of disaster risk financing strategies, we use historical data on natural disasters from the Emergency Events Database and government expenditure data from the Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability database.", "dataset": ["Emergency Events Database", "Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability database"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a new dataset on participation and dropout rates in tertiary education across countries, using information from the UNESCO Institute for Statistics.", "dataset": ["new dataset on participation and dropout rates in tertiary education", "UNESCO Institute for Statistics"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "In order to better understand the relationship between deforestation and economic development, we use data on forest cover change from the Global Forest Watch and GDP per capita from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Global Forest Watch", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a dataset of firm-level investment climate surveys conducted by the World Bank Group across Africa to better understand the role of governance practices in attracting foreign investment.", "dataset": ["firm-level investment climate surveys conducted by the World Bank Group across Africa"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To study the impact of infrastructure investment on economic growth, we use data on transport infrastructure from the World Development Indicators and electricity access from the Sustainable Energy for All database.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Sustainable Energy for All database"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Energy"]}]
